comments.commentBody: Putin would NEVER get his hands dirty. He would bump off the mechanic he hired to do so to cover his tracks.

Mr. McConnell, Mr. Ryan, and other GOP leaders,
I ask just how much evidence do you need, and how can your conscience allow you to stay silent putting your party ahead of the country.

Someday soon, after the inevitable crisis, your constituents will be looking you in the eye, asking why in God's name did you not speak and act out when the evidence was there. Why did you ignore reality?

This is now more than the actions of our delusional so-called President. The leaders of the GOP must now take ownership of this soap opera!
You're assuming Messrs. McConnell, Ryan, et all, have operative consciences. I believe they do not.

You're probably right, but for being polite I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.  My appeal is really for their constituents to put enough pressure on them so to make it in their self-interest to do the right thing.  I really do share your skepticism about Turtle Boy and Eddie Munster, but I try to be a mensch about it.   :-)

It's really quite simple: Trump is certifiably crazy. He clearly needs help, and for our collective good, as soon as possible. I was hoping that he might avail himself of section 3 of the XXV amendment and make an honorable exit. Hoping for that makes me as delusional as him I suppose but it was a nice thought. Impeachment is a stretch, at least at this point, so it's up to Pence and the cabinet to get the ball rolling on section 4 of the XXVth. Will they have the good sense and the courage to defy the nut case? Well, unfortunately, courage seems to be a rare commodity amongst those in a position to actually do something about this unstable, dangerous creature. Trump will probably have to take us all to the absolute brink before we see any light at the end of the tunnel.

Lance Dodes, retired professsor of psychiatry, Harvard Medical School, has submitted a letter, Feb. 13, to the Editors of the NYT and signed by 35 other psychiatrists stating Trump's unsuitability for the Presidency due to serious mental issues. I would think that the CIA or related would be responsible for pursuing this. Not sure if the government is actually functional at this stage. Dodes letter is on line.
I'm disappointed that the NYT is reporting this. It's not necessary to report every absurd tweet.  It only legitimizes Mr Trump and follows a pattern that the media indulged in during the campaign.
I agree. The media should just ignore him, just like the boy who cried wolf.
I disagree, Susan.  the NYT didn't just report the tweet, they provided accurate background information about it.  Plus, when POTUS makes outrageous statements, it's news. Period.
I disagree intense with your point of view, Susan.  The NYT and other legitimate media must report this - otherwise it's left for Fox news and Breitbart to interpret and mislead.

The winner since the inauguration is the American people. Frankly with a conspiracy theorist tweeting constitutional trampling commander in chief, we have all a front row view of how democracy works. The media is has finally woken up from a lull, and Mr. President, you have our full attention.

I fail to understand why so many think Trump's allegations must have some origin.
Trump needed to move the spotlight from the Russian connections and nothing better than an outrageous claim to do it
Trump revealed his gameplan with his reference to McCarthyism
McCarthy often made similar claims without a shred of evidence
Trump may be President but he will never be presidential and can at most attempt to act so for no more than 24 hours

This is actually rather amusing. The same people demanding proof from the president that his phones were tapped by the FBI looking for connections between his campaign and the Russians demand none from those claiming there was such a collusion. President Trump may be off base claiming President Obama personally ordered it, but is it so unreasonable to believe that the FBI or FISA may have? Or that President Obama was the big boss at the time? IOW, did President Obama not have oversight?

And how many people didn't see this coming? Bound to happen, IMO. You start accusing the president every day of unseemly connections with the Russians, with no proof at all, and he's going to eventually fight back. We may be seeing the beginning of all of this partisan silliness backfiring on the New York Times - who will end up with egg on their faces yet again. Better have your supply department order some more towels and soap to clean it off - again. Order now and we hear there is an 84% chance you will get it within a few weeks!

Don't be ridiculous RichD. Of course people are demanding evidence. That is why we are demanding a select committee. And don't minimize the role of a federal judge should the FBI have requested a tap. More false equivalence.
He does have unseemly connections to the Russians, Rich. You will see.

Not everyone is simply pro-Trump or anti-Trump. Some of us take it piece by piece and possibility by possibility. One can believe that the Sessions issue is a diversion without thinking much of Sessions (I don't) and without being a Trump supporter (I didn't vote for him) or defending his absurd and harmful birtherism.

You wouldn't know it by reading the NYT and WaPo and watching CNN, but there are lots of people coming awake to the fact that neither Party represents them, lots of people who don't fit the liberal or conservative option. People who are more politically fluid. More case by case about committing.
As Lindsay Graham said today - if Obama, a constitutional lawyer - legally obtained a wire tap from FISA - then a libel suit is the least of Trumps worries.

We would have gotten the same behavior and results if one of those white, whiney, militia tag-a-long, online conspiracy reading (and believing), too many guns owning but kid ain't going to college yahoos from any of our western states that took over the refuge whiners.
Oh, did I write whiner twice?
I mean't whiner twice.

Trump is just like these guys except he claims losses in the near billions and has far tackier taste. And unfortunately is far more dangerous to far more people.

Trump you are officially the worst president in US history and it's only week 6.

What's the unPresident trying to distract attention from today?
Why is any reputable news organization giving publicity to his paranoid blathering?
Make him learn that lies may work in swindling sales meetings, but evidence and facts are needed in serious public policy discourse.
I am increasingly convinced Trump is just a shaved orangutan. Both are orange, but most orangutans learn social grace and moderation by adulthood.
Pence and his wife must lie in bed at night and chit-chat about how they'll decorate the residential rooms at the White House.  Let's face it, the Rump is not going to make it even six months.
Well, hold on. Obama may sue him for defamation. Wouldn't that be grand!!?!?

drywolf

OK, three strikes for your team.

Of course, everybody blamed Bush because his policies and his party created the worst US economy since the depression, and very nearly brought the rest of the world along for the ride.

Then after they were tossed from office, the same people refused to do anything to repair the damage. If not for Obama's action, you would not have an automobile industry, your biggest investors and insurers would be gone, and we would still be far from normal growth or employment.

Now, please, tell me what part of "blaming" Bush for that would be inappropriate. Except Obama had too much class to engage in extended blame, he just wanted to fix the problem.

You people, on the other hand, were openly cheering for the chance to stand on the sidelines and watch General Motors go down with all its employees, factories, and hopes for the future.

You wanted that so bad it hurt. Like Evangelicals are desperate to create open war in the Middle East. A sick, all consuming devotion to your fantasy of being all knowing and unfailingly correct in your perverse ideas of how to run an economy.

Trump, on the hand, is just making things up and pouting when nobody believes him. Again.

When I read articles like this I am so glad I am involved in the pro-life movement. I am currently participating with 40 Days For Life groups which take place in every state in the country and many countries around the world. In Manhattan where I volunteer, we stand outside the Planned Parenthood facility and quietly pray to end abortion. We stand across the street from Planned Parenthood, do not block the entrance nor confront those women entering the facility. We are peaceful and do not cause any disturbances.

Our main goal is to end the destruction of babies in the womb and to unite with other pro-life supporters. There are many women's health centers that provide the needed services that PP offers except abortion. We also do not desert the women and babies after birth as there are centers where they may go to live which offer job training and much needed services.

Abortion is an important human rights issue of the day and the current administration has given us their full support. We are fortunate to have Vice President Mike Pence and Kellyanne Conway on our side. It is so comforting to know we are not alone in the struggle to end abortion. We have made tremendous strides but have not completed our goal. We will continue to speak out against abortion and save innocent lives.

WMK, if you invested a modicum of your soul and energy in reading comprehension skills, you could have learned what I truly am:

Pro-sex-education
Pro-affordable-healthcare
Pro-free/cheap-contraception (condoms, IUD implants, birth control pills)
Pro-modernity
Pro-women
Pro-choice

But out of all those plainly articulated ideas, the only thing you could see and the only thing you could comprehend was 'pro-abortion'.

As long as your 'pro-life' monomania consumes your consciousness to the total exclusion of real-life context, the abortion rate you pretend to be fighting against will stay high, yet another monument to religious denialism, delusion and disregard of reality.

Get the world some sex education and affordable modern contraception and the abortion rate will plummet.....but unfortunately, you're just not interested.

Sad.

If you want to end destruction of babies in the womb, as you put it, support the right of women and men to have access to contraception, sex education, family planning services. Standing outside and praying is easy. As for not deserting the women and babies after birth, yes you are because you don't understand how it feels to be pregnant when you don't want to have a child. And you don't understand what it's like to be that unwanted child.

Just so you know, I'll tell you from my point of view, not for sympathy but for a dose of reality. Being unwanted means being abused verbally and physically. It means worrying that your parents will kill you. It means not telling anyone anything because you can't trust them: they will go back to your parents who will hurt you. It affects you with respect to intimate relationships: in my case I've never really had one. Your parents demonstrate to you, in a variety of ways, including telling you that they didn't want you, how unwanted, unloved, and unlovable you are. I'm 58 years old and I wish my parents had never had me. And no, I wouldn't know the difference because I wouldn't be here.

Economic status is not the determining factor. Wanting the child is. A poor parent who wants a child will be a far better parent than one who doesn't. A woman who wants a child will think of the fetus as a baby whereas one who doesn't considers it a parasite. If you want to end abortion support educating children and teens about sex.

There is no Pro-Life and there is no Pro-Abortion.  It's Anti-Choice and Pro-Choice.  The fight extends much further than a woman's right to choose abortion, if and when it may be necessary.  The fight is about a woman's right to make her own health choices and family planning choices. Period.
Now, on top of all other worries about President Trump, we must consider paranoid schizophrenia.

While I agree completely that what Trump eats is hardly at the top of the "food chain" (sorry - couldn't resist!) of concern, it is worth pointing out that attacking others for their food choices is hardly new.  The right has spent 8 years attacking Michelle Obama for having the temerity to shine a light upon the need for children and adults to eat healthier fare overall.  The fact is that we have an obesity epidemic in this nation, with significant public health consequences - like it or not, we must address this in a more cohesive fashion than has been the case.  "Let him eat steak; let him eat cake" - I don't really care.  The problem is not ketchup - it is that he is unfit to serve in the office he currently holds, and has appointed an entire clown care full of people dedicated to destroying the agencies they head, and the  lives of millions of people and our environment. Let us not lose sight of that.  3/4, 7:28 PM

he problem is not ketchup???

It is if it ain't Heinz. Than it's just plain old Catsup. LOL

You make a good point.
Remember the right wing's disparaging of Volvo-driving arugula-eating liberals. And who could ever forget "Cheese-eating Surrender Monkeys." I think that was a reference to the French who opposed the Iraq War. Oh, yes. Freedom Fries also came out of that same alliterative diet-driven diatribe. Now it's fashionable to be a Republican and oppose the Iraq War, but the French are still considered fat and lazy.... correction... just lazy. The fat ones are the ones hurling all the stones.

We "Liberals" who I like to call "Intellects" for their thoughtfulness and caring, give consideration to our thoughts and deeds. We have filters to control what we say to avoid exposing the perturbations and randomness of our thoughts. We try not to offend with words. We are thinkers. Unlike us, Trump appears to lack a filter for his words to the point where the regular paranoid inclinations and incorrect thoughts inherent in all of us make it through to be verbalized without conscience or control. Therefor we can guess Trump is imagining things and letting go his hysteria unrestrained by any filter.

So what if his phones were tapped? If anything, his overreacting indicates he has knowledge of his own wrongdoing.
How about Trump's birtherism nonsense? It got him to the White House. Trump isn't the only sick one...

Many of us have done so. Over and over.

When an ordinary citizen can see it, there's no need for professionals!
Terrible! Bad guy! A new low! = the person in office.

Hey, to can't believe how stupid Americans are? It's been evident for awhile. Look what's on 500 channels on American TV, look how Americans are driving SUVs when they've heard that fossil fuels are finite as well as damaging to the environment, how 75 per cent of them thought Saddam Hussein was involved in bringing down the Twin Towers....etc etc.

You are wrong. Trump actually has proof of all this.

It is all revealed in his income tax returns.
Nice one. Had a good laugh, now go get that remote away from Melania.
It's the FBI. They got a warrant from the FISA court in October.

"The new is fake!"

"Where do you get your information Mr Trump?"

"The news."

The hypocrisy of this man, his willingness to throw any and all stones without a shred of evidence, his incessant rantings of his popularity and picking fights with people who are being 'mean' to him....its like watching a child throw a tantrum. It's surreal and terrifying.
